docs.snippet: Mr. Marshall, one of the first black actors to have a starring role on an American network television series, also appeared in television movies and feature films.

headline.print_headline: Don Marshall, 80, of ‘Land of the Giants’
headline.main: Don Marshall, Who Made Casting History in ‘Land of the Giants,’ Is Dead at 80

docs.abstract: Don Marshall, one of first black actors to star on an American television series, playing first officer on late 1960s science fiction show Land of the Giants, dies at age 80.

docs.snippet: Yes, you heard that right. Samsung is asking owners of its fire-prone Galaxy Note 7 to do something crazy: "power down and stop using the device."

headline.print_headline: For Smartphone-Dependent World, Samsung Troubles Hit Hard
headline.main: For Smartphone-Dependent World, Samsung Troubles Hit Hard

docs.snippet: Thai student Chokchai Thongnuakao almost died when he swam across a university campus pond on the orders of a senior. He was half way to other side when cramp stuck and he went under.

headline.print_headline: Near Drowning of Thai Student Renews Calls to End Hazing
headline.main: Near Drowning of Thai Student Renews Calls to End Hazing

docs.snippet: Three Syrians who overwhelmed a fugitive wanted in an alleged Islamic extremist bomb plot and handed him over to police were hailed as heroes in Germany Tuesday, helping temper anti-migrant sentiment fueled in part by fears of such attacks.

headline.print_headline: Germany: Syrians Who Tied Up Bomb Suspect Hailed as Heroes
headline.main: Germany: Syrians Who Tied Up Bomb Suspect Hailed as Heroes

docs.snippet: Leaflets dropped over the besieged city warned inhabitants, “If you don’t leave these areas quickly you will be annihilated.”

headline.print_headline: Thousands Flee Aleppo’s East as Assad’s Forces Gain Ground
headline.main: Thousands Flee Parts of Aleppo, Syria, as Assad’s Forces Gain Ground

docs.snippet: When Arthur Bondar came across the negatives of a Soviet war photographer, he realized he had stumbled upon an important cache of images of World War II that gave an intimate look at that country’s side.

headline.main: Rare Photos Show World War II From the Soviet Side

docs.abstract: When Arthur Bondar came across the negatives of a Soviet war photographer, he realized he had stumbled upon an important cache of images of World War II that gave an intimate look at that country’s side.

docs.snippet: Readers respond to Zadie Smith’s By the Book interview and more.

Keith Scott, the black man fatally shot by a black police officer in Charlotte, North Carolina, on Tuesday, was remembered by family members and neighbors as a "likeable" person as the city braced for possibly more rioting triggered by his killing...

headline.print_headline: Factbox: Slain Charlotte Man Described as Courteous Father of Seven
headline.main: Factbox: Slain Charlotte Man Described as Courteous Father of Seven

docs.snippet: A court in Myanmar indicted a man on Monday for insulting the military chief and former president on social media, under a controversial telecommunications law that activists have urged the new government to repeal.

headline.print_headline: Myanmar Man Indicted for Insulting Military Under Controversial Law
headline.main: Myanmar Man Indicted for Insulting Military Under Controversial Law

docs.snippet: The search giant faces three cases accusing it of hampering consumer choice and crippling competitors, all of which it denies.

headline.print_headline: Google Points to Europe’s Digital Market in Rebutting Antitrust Charges
headline.main: Google Rebuts Antitrust Claims in Europe
